kafkardd.kafkardd module¶

kafkardd.offset_manager module¶

class kafkardd.offset_manager.KafkaOffsetManager(config)[source]¶

Bases: object

Kafka offset fetcher Args:

config (dict): configuration
‘hosts’ (str)
: hosts list of Kafka cluster seperated by ‘,’
ex. ‘192.168.67.65:9092,192.168.67.67:9092’

‘topic’ (str) : Kafka topic to fetch ‘timestamp_extractor’ (callback, optional) : function to extract timestamp from messages

required for get_offsets_by_timestamp() and get_timestamp_by_offsets()
get_earliest_offsets()[source]¶

Get earliest offsets of each partitions Args:

None
Returns:
dict : offsets of each partitions { pid (int) : offset (int) }
get_latest_offsets()[source]¶

Get latest offsets of each partitions Args:

None
Returns:
dict : offsets of each partitions { pid (int) : offset (int) }
get_offsets_by_timestamp(timestamp)[source]¶

Get latest offsets of each partitions which message timestamp less than target timestamp Assume timestamp of messages in each partitions are monotone increasing Args:

timestamp (int) : target timestamp
Returns:
dict : offsets of each partitions { pid (int) : offset (int) }
get_timestamp_by_offsets(offsets)[source]¶

Get timestamp of each partitions with given offsets Args:

offsets (dict) : { pid : offset }
Returns:
dict : timestamps of each partitions { pid (int) : offset (int) }
stop()[source]¶

Stop manager Args:

None
Returns:
None
class kafkardd.offset_manager.ZKOffsetManager(config, partitions)[source]¶

Bases: object

Zookeeper offset manager for using Zookeeper to manage offsets fetching and committing Args:

config (dict): configuration
‘hosts’ (str)
: hosts list of Zookeeper cluster seperated by ‘,’
ex. ‘192.168.67.65:2181,192.168.67.67:2181’

‘znode’ (str) : znode path, the name space consists of data registers

kafkardd.util module¶

kafkardd.util.generate_chunk(ranges, chunk_size)[source]¶

Split ranges into chunks with proper size. Args:

ranges (dict): ranges[partition] = (start, end) chunk_size (int): the max size of each chunk,

if less than zero, it won’t chunk
Yields:
list of (partition, start, end)
Examples:
>>> list(generate_chunk({0: (0, 10), 1: (5, 5), 2: (5, 20)}, 5))
[[(0, 0, 5), (2, 5, 10)], [(0, 5, 10), (2, 10, 15)], [(2, 15, 20)]]
>>> list(generate_chunk({0: (0, 10), 1: (5, 5), 2: (5, 20)}, -1))
[[(0, 0, 10), (2, 5, 20)]]
kafkardd.util.split_chunks_by_parallelism(chunks, parallelism)[source]¶

Split chunks into smaller chunks according to parallelism Args:

chunks (list): list of (partition, start, end) parallelism (int): number for parallel processing
Returns:
list of (partition, start, end)
Examples:
>>> split_chunks_by_parallelism([(0, 0, 10), (2, 5, 20)], 5)
[(0, 0, 5), (0, 5, 10), (2, 5, 13), (2, 13, 20)]
>>> split_chunks_by_parallelism([(0, 0, 10), (2, 5, 20)], 0)
[(0, 0, 10), (2, 5, 20)]
